intro: Spondianthus preussii subsp. preussii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is typically grown as a houseplant due to its preference for warm, humid conditions. It produces small, elliptical leaves with a smooth texture and has a compact growth habit. The flowers are usually borne on short pedicels and bloom during the spring and summer months.
